00099     void setMode(GuiMode newMode)
00100     {
00101       if (newMode==GM_Inventory && allowed==GW_None)
00102         return;
00103 
00104       mode = newMode;
00105       updateVisible();
00106     }
00107     void setNextMode(GuiMode newMode);
00108 
00109     GuiMode getMode() const { return mode; }
00110 
00111     bool isGuiMode() const { return getMode() != GM_Game; } // Everything that is not game mode is considered "gui mode"
00112 
00113     // Disallow all inventory mode windows
00114     void disallowAll()
00115     {
00116       allowed = GW_None;
00117       updateVisible();
00118     }
00119 
00120     // Allow one or more windows
00121     void allow(GuiWindow wnd)
00122     {
00123       allowed = (GuiWindow)(allowed | wnd);
00124       updateVisible();
00125     }
00126 
00127     MWGui::DialogueWindow* getDialogueWindow() {return dialogueWindow;}

00211     /* Currently ALLOWED windows in inventory mode. This is used at
00212        the start of the game, when windows are enabled one by one
00213        through script commands. You can manipulate this through using
00214        allow() and disableAll().
00215 
00216        The setting should also affect visibility of certain HUD
00217        elements, but this is not done yet.
00218      */
00219     GuiWindow allowed;

00231   template<typename T>
00232   void WindowManager::removeDialog(T*& dialog)
00233   {
00234       OEngine::GUI::Layout *d = static_cast<OEngine::GUI::Layout*>(dialog);
00235       removeDialog(d);
00236       dialog = 0;
00237   }
